result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
10:24 AM Defendant Larry Adam Strothman in court.  Attorney Jane Krueger Smith in court for Larry Adam Strothman.  Attorney Matt Lantta in court for State of Wisconsin. Matter set over.
Pre-trial conference scheduled for November 22, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Pre-trial conference on November 22, 2022 at 08:30 am.

11:26 AM Defendant Larry Adam Strothman in court.  Attorney Jane Krueger Smith in court for Larry Adam Strothman.  Attorney Matt Lantta in court for State of Wisconsin. Preliminary hearing questionnaire and waiver filed with the Court. Defendant knowingly and voluntarily waives his right to a preliminary hearing. The Court reviews the waiver and accepts. Court finds probable cause.  Defendant bound over for trial. Information filed.  Court advises defendant of charges & penalties. Defendant waives reading of information. Defendant stands mute, Court enters not guilty plea on defendants behalf. Bond continues. Matter set over.
Pre-trial conference scheduled for October 18, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Pre-trial conference on October 18, 2022 at 08:30 am.

records.addlTxt:
Violation: OWI 4th
Issuing Agency: GCSD
May not possess or consume any intoxicants. 
May not enter establishments (to include bars, taverns, or other premises) whose primary purpose is the sale of intoxicants with the exception of gas stations and grocery stores.  May enter gas stations and grocery stores but may not go into the area where intoxicants are sold. 
May not operate a motor vehicle without a valid driver's license on a public highway or roadway in the State of Wisconsin.

1:19 PM Defendant Larry Adam Strothman appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Matt Lantta appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. Attorney Jane Krueger Smith appeared by video for the defendant. Defendant qualifies for SPD. Court advises defendant of rights.  Court advises defendant of charges and penalties. Defendant has received a copy of the criminal complaint. Bond set. Matter set over.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for September 8, 2022 at 11:30 am.
